glossentry.glossdef: The IEEE 754-2008 standard term for a floating-point operand with a zero exponent and a nonzero fraction field. Arm documentation describes these operands as denormal or denormalized, as defined by the IEEE 754-1985 standard. Note Arm floating-point implementations comply with the IEEE 754 requirement that denormalized operands are generated and manipulated with the same precision as normal operands. Plus or minus 0 have zero exponent fields, but are not denormals because there is no loss of accuracy.
